conbody.p: The Health Informatics Centre (HIC) is a University research support unit operating within the College of Medicine, Dentistry & Nursing at the University of Dundee, in collaboration with National Health Service (NHS) Tayside and NHS Fife. HIC supports high impact research through the collection and management of high quality data in a secure environment with strong data governance. HIC provides data users with linked, anonymised information derived from large population based health datasets, owned mainly by the NHS and the University of Dundee . These datasets are used by researchers in epidemiological studies with the ultimate goal of improving healthcare delivery and population health outcomes.

The objective of this document is to provide metadata catalogue for researchers, Information Service Division (ISD), and other safe havens so that they can ask for relevant datasets for particular projects. The primary audience for this document are data analysts, researchers, and healthcare stakeholders, who exploit the HIC-held datasets for various research purposes.
